parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma3
</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>0.56
</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Vehicle Inventory

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns the amount (1 is full) of ammo resources in the cargo space of a rearm vehicle. <br><br>
<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature </title><part><name index="1"/><value> Informative </value></part><part><name index="2"/><value> Since Arma 3 v1.94.145939 the return value for vehicles that are not configured to have ability to rearm other vehicles is -1. (Prior to that the value was negative infinity)</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''getAmmoCargo''' vehicle

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> vehicle: [[Object]]

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Number]] - ammo cargo value, -1 if ammo cargo is not supported, 0 if the vehicle is ![[alive]] or [[isNull]]

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>value = [[getAmmoCargo]] myVehicleName;</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[setAmmoCargo]], [[getFuelCargo]], [[getRepairCargo]]
</value></part></template>

<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on December 22, 2014 - 17:16 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:AgentRevolution|AgentRev]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
'''Prior to Arma 3 v1.93.145625''' If the vehicle is not [[alive]], it always returns [[Nothing]], which you should check for using [[isNil]].<br>
If the vehicle is unable to carry that type of cargo, it returns [[Number#Number_Type|-1.#IND]], which you should check for using [[finite]] or [[a_less_b | <]] 0.
</dd>
</dl>
<comment><!-- DISCONTINUE Notes --></comment></root>
